Title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of
    which may lead to a Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: OpenSSL is a robust, commercial-grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain private keying material, or gain access to sensitive information.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenSSL users should upgrade to the latest version:
